James Brown.action: James does not escalate the conflict when Nafloyd and Bobby are about to throw down over money issues.
James Brown.assessment: By not engaging in the confrontation and instead offering a solution, James demonstrates tolerance and a calming presence, which are positive indicators of warmth.

James Brown.action: James walks through the night, sweaty and exhausted, to make a phone call and then shows concern when he hears something upsetting on the phone.

James Brown.action: James calmly responds to Nafloyd's aggressive questioning about money by saying, 'I'm taking you to the money, Nafloyd,' while tapping his head.

James Brown.action: James is described as a sweaty mess after walking through the night but still manages to make an important phone call and show concern.

James Brown.action: James spends all their money on a record that is currently sitting in trash cans outside major record companies.

James Brown.action: James reaches over and grabs the waitress' hand while speaking to her.

James Brown.action: James responds to Bobby's joke about getting coffee and a donut by saying 'Knock yourself out' and putting coins on the table.

James Brown.action: James introduces themselves to the waitress as 'Musicians. We the Famous Flames.'

James Brown.action: Shrugs when Bobby explains the cancelled show and their dire situation.

James Brown.action: Considers Bobby's options and puts coins on the table, allowing Bobby to decide how to spend the limited money.

James Brown.action: Responds to the waitress's skepticism with charm and confidence, attempting to uplift their image despite their disheveled appearance.
James Brown.assessment: James demonstrates social skill and confidence, using charisma to manage a potentially negative interaction, which is a competent social strategy.

James Brown.action: Grabs the waitress's hand and delivers a poetic line about needing a spark to turn their fortunes around.

James Brown.action: Winks at the waitress before she walks away.

James Brown.action: Disappears under the table and hides when a police officer arrives.

James Brown.action: Crawls out from under the table and politely greets Ralph Bass with 'Hi.'

James Brown.action: Expresses concern about not wanting to return to prison.

James Brown.action: Instantly changes expression and disappears under the table when a cop arrives looking for him.
James Brown.assessment: This shows quick situational awareness and a survival instinct, indicating a capacity to respond rapidly to threats, though it also reveals fear and vulnerability.

James Brown.action: Crawls out from under the table and confidently introduces himself to Ralph Bass from King Records.
James Brown.assessment: Despite initial fear, James is able to compose himself and engage professionally with an important music industry figure, demonstrating social and professional competence.

James Brown.action: Whispers that he is not supposed to leave Bibb County without telling his parole officer.

James Brown.action: James leans into the studio mic and passionately sings 'Please, Please, Please' with the Flames, putting everything they've got into the performance.
James Brown.assessment: This shows dedication and a collaborative spirit, indicating a sincere and committed approach to his music and group, which can be seen as a warm, engaging behavior.

James Brown.assessment: While this shows James's high standards and commitment to quality, his disregard for the group's feelings and the tension caused suggests a lack of tolerance and sensitivity, indicating lower warmth.

James Brown.action: James leans into the studio mic and sings with full effort, leading the group in recording 'Please, Please, Please'.
James Brown.assessment: This shows James's confidence and skill as a performer, demonstrating his ability to take charge in a high-pressure recording environment.

James Brown.action: James stops the recording session mid-take, insisting the tempo is too slow and needs to be picked up.

James Brown.action: James stands alone looking up at the towering King Records building.
James Brown.assessment: This moment suggests a contemplative or uncertain stance, possibly indicating some hesitation or lack of immediate action, which is a neutral indicator of competence.

James Brown.action: Insists on pushing the pace of the ballad to make it more engaging and emotionally stirring, despite others advising against it.

James Brown.action: Continues to sing 'Please Please Please' with intense focus, seemingly oblivious to the frustration and anger of the producers and others around him.

James Brown.action: Insists on changing the pace of the ballad to be faster and more driving, despite objections from experienced colleagues.

James Brown.action: Ignores the concerns of Bobby and Ralph Bass and pushes for his own interpretation of the song.

James Brown.action: Nails his lead vocal on 'Please Please Please' despite the unconventional pacing and structure.

James Brown.action: Appears oblivious to the negative reaction from Syd Nathan and others in the booth, lost in the moment of his performance.

James Brown.action: James smiles at the crowd after performing and nods to Bobby to resume the song, then throws off his towel and runs back on stage to continue performing with passion.

James Brown.action: THE FAMOUS FLAMES are back on stage at Big Bills only now THEY OWN THE ROOM. A packed standing room only house is going wild for James and the flames.
James Brown.assessment: This indicates James Brown's ability to captivate and command a large audience, demonstrating strong stage presence and performance skill.

James Brown.action: James sings PLEASE! at a much faster pace than at King. Aunt Honey and her girls bump and grind to the music.

James Brown.action: James lowers to the floor and belts his heart out as the song concludes.

James Brown.action: James walks off stage and just outside Big Bills. A bath towel is put over James' back and head to absorb his sweat. James is breathing hard, completely exhausted.

James Brown.action: James slowly rises his head from under his towel and looks right at us. He begins to smile. He then looks over to Bobby and nods. The band resumes Please, Please, Please.
James Brown.assessment: This shows James's awareness and control over the performance flow, signaling leadership and confidence.

James Brown.action: Suddenly James throws the towel off of himself and runs to the stage. The cape act is born.

James Brown.action: James jumps onto the floor singing as if for his life. He soon disappears into a sea of women pulling at his clothes.

James Brown.action: Responds firmly and alone to Ben Bart's praise, emphasizing 'Not we James. Not the Famous Flames. You. James Brown.'

James Brown.action: Acknowledges the situation clearly and confidently, stating 'I knew it six months ago. Hell, I knew it the day I was born.'

James Brown.action: Insists that the band members work for him and that the name 'James Brown and his Famous Flames' be used, despite the label's preference to drop the Flames.

James Brown.action: Responds confidently and assertively to Ben Bart's praise, acknowledging that the success is his alone, not the band's.

James Brown.action: Anticipates the purpose of the meeting and the shift in power dynamics, stating he knew about it 'six months ago' and 'the day I was born.'

James Brown.action: Maintains steady eye contact without blinking when addressing the group.

James Brown.action: Insists that the band name remain in some form despite the label's push to remove it.

James Brown.action: Does not visibly react negatively or lose composure when the band members express confusion and concern about the name change.

James Brown.action: Stares straight ahead and does not immediately respond to Nafloyd's anger.

James Brown.action: Insists that the band work for him under his name, despite their objections.

James Brown.action: Negotiates to get four hours of airtime on the radio with a microphone and turn-table despite low pay.
